text: W porównaniu do 12-stki w wyglądzie brak lacingu, w zapachu i w smaku dużo wyraźniejsza beczka, trochę przytłaczająca resztę, kwaśniejsze.
Bottle @Craigs (Abstrakt tasting). Pours black with a tan head. Nose is whisky, peat, chocolate, slight dark fruits. Taste is chocolate, whisky, smoke.

33 cl. bottled April 2014, number 02398. Jet black with a lasting film of creamy foam. Smell is chocolate, vanilla, salty peat, and toasted oak. Initial tastes of dark chocolate, caramel, blackberry and raisin. Finish has delicate smoke, sea salt, prune, fig, soy, earthy leaf, vanilla and whiskey. Medium-plus body has a smooth nearly-medium carbonation and an excellent balance. I could drink this all night if I could afford it.

Bottle 33cl, date april 2014. Pours deep dark with a small brown head. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate and cherry. Full body, medium oily, flat carbonation. Taste is vanilla, burbon, roasted malt and a bit smoky. Nice bitterness. Long and strong. 05/17

How: Bottle.
Where: Tasting 2017-05-06.
Appearance: Black colour with a very small tan head.
Aroma: Caramel, dried fruit, some whiskey, some chocolate and vanilla.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Chocolate, caramel, dried fruit, whiskey, vanilla.
Bottled at AndySnow tasting.  Very dark brown, small coarse head. Coffee and caramel, mild whisky. Mid dry medium-full body and well rounded mouthfeel. Richly malty, mellow whisky. Nice!
Pro mě nová a zajímavá zkuenost. Něco takového jsem jetě nepil. Ale tato originalita se velice cení a já hodnotím na výbornou!

330 ml bottle. Peat dark chocolate aroma. Malt dark chocolate toffee scotch finish. Medium light body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear dark ruby brown, almost black. Tanned lacing foam. OK it has whiskey tones in aroma and taste, but not too outspoken. A smooth well balanced beer. (Velp 201703)

Bottle, 08533, April 2014 (thanks BlazerT). Pours black with beige head. Aroma is sweet, peat, intense whiskey (but not hot), malt, sugar, fruits. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, malt, some wet paper, oak, some metallic notes. Finish is mild roast bitter with slight booze. Covers alcohol really well, almost watery. Overall: very good, very mellow.

Bottle. Teku. Pitch black with tiny, semi-thick, light brown head. Almost none of head retention and lacing. Moderate to heavy sweet, chocolate, peated woody, oaky. Moderately sweet, flat, woody bitter. In overall in this one ABV is noticeable - mostly in aroma, also wooden and oaky notes are more present here. Rather flat and raw, without any sophisticated accents.
Sweet aroma of vanilla & chocolate. Black with nearly no head. Light sweet, very dry & light bitter. Light body, average carbonation & slick texture.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Nieprzyjemny, chamski alkohol, paloność, mocno płaskie w smaku... Duuuże rozczarowanie

Kolor: ciemnobrunatny, klarowny.<r>
Piana: niska, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, nietrwała.
Zapach: dość wyraźne nuty beczki, whisky, trochę ciemnych, suszonych owoców, fig, daktyli, śliwek, lekka czekolada, kawa, aromaty palne.
Smak: lekka pełnia, wyraźne nuty beczki, whisky, wyraźne nuty ciemnych, suszonych owoców, lekka słodycz, trochę czekolady, kawy, goryczka w kierunku średniej.
Wysycenie: średnie.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2017 W aromacie nuty waniliowe, beczkowe, drewniane, czekoladowe, kakao, nuty whisky, przyjemny aromat. W wyglądzie czarne z obrączką beżowej piany. W smaku nuty torfowe, ciemne owoce, czekolada, kakao, wanilia, nuty drewniane, trochę tytoniu, finisz w stylu whisky. Ciało średnie, nieco go brakuje. Ogólnie smaczny, ułożony, przyjemny old ale, choć nieco brakuje ciała i intensywności.

Bottle at Craigs. Pours deep brown with a modest bubbly brown head. Aroma is sherry, oak, dried fruits (small hint of oxidation). Taste is dried fruit sweet, sherry, cocoa bitter, hint of peaty smoke. Medium bodied,

Bottle
Aroma-whiskey, caramel
Appearance-brown, hazy, beige foam
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Bottle. Pours dark brown, almost black and has a very thin dark scum across the top. I smell butter, a touch of whisky, vanilla and a bit of wood. The taste is quite licoricey, some dark bitter chocolate, some vanilla, a little biscuit. Very very tasty.

A 330ml foiled and capped bottle, bottle no. 00214, bottled in April 2014, and best before end of May 2017. Poured into a snifter glass. It was a clear dark brown colour with pretty much no head and only very sparse spotted lacing. Aromas of chocolate, whisky, wood and vanilla with maybe a touch of coffee. Tastes of dark chocolate, roasty malts and coffee bean, whisky and vanilla with a hint of sweet dark fruit, raisin, plum and prunes on the finish. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Overall, nice roastiness and vanilla with subtle but clear whisky notes makes this go down easy. Definitely on the lookout for the other years now.

Bottle No: 08412. Vintage 04.2014. Pianka srednia, szybko opada, brazowa ciecz gesta, oleista i bez mozliwosci przepuszczenia swiatla. Zapach torfowy, ziemisty, w smaku torfowosc trufle wedzone sliwki oraz sporo owocow niebieskich typu borowka, jagoda i aronia. Orzechowe smaki mieszajace sie z gozka czekolada, malo tu slodyczy, sporo czekolady ale takiej minimum 90% kakao, goryczka i wytrawnosc srednia ale za to na zakonczenie mamy silna palonosc slodow, drewno takze daje sie zaznaczyc na sam koniec. Klasyk, 21 letnie beczki oddaly to co powinny, piwo jest bardzo nietypowe i raczej dla zaawansowanych pasjonatow ratebeer niz dla przecietnych konsumentow piwa. Lovelly Old style Ale.

Pitch black with nice head. Aroma is whiskey, wood, cocoa, coffee, roasted dark malt, caramel and dark chocolate. Semi carbonation. 
Taste follows the nose. First there is sweetness that turns to moderate bitterness, nonetheless maintaining the balance. 
Long lasting taste of whisky and malts. Enjoyed with a brownie and dark chocolate.
Chocolade, coffee, peat, vanilla, toffee, wood tannins, roasted tones. Whiskey is subtly present. Low carbonation. Medium body. Well balanced. Great complexity. Absolutely great.

Wonderful aroma of oak barrels, whiskey, dark malt, dark berries and some vanilla. The taste is of watery coffee, oak, dark chocolate and dark malt. Good bitterness that fills the mouth forever. The taste and smell are quite different. The scent is wonderful but the taste is a little musty. Had expected me more flavor. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
How: bottle Appearance; almost black, tiny khaki head. Aroma-: prunes, caramel, coffee, wood, blackberries, cherries, brown sugar. Palate: medium body, soft carbonation.

Bottle from Cap Tap. Pours very dark brown with a slight, transient tan head. Aroma of chocolate and peat smoke. Really quite pleasant. Approaching full bodied. Flavor is chocolate, peat smoke and dark malt. Its a bit sweet, but there is accompanying bitter. Finish is earthy, peaty, chocolaty. Maybe woody too. Really good stuff.

Bottle, Feb 2014, vintage. Poured into the snifter.

Aroma: dark chocolate, peat, signs of the oxidation: dried plum, soy sauce, coffee.

Pours dark brown, almost jet black, hazy. Quite nice tan beige head.

Taste: peat and dark chocolate as two dominating notes. Lovely signs of oxidation: soy sauce, a lot of dried plums. A hint of coffee in the background.

Full bodied, medium to oily texture. Bitter finish. A little bit too fizzy.

Seems to be less sweet than 18. In the same time - more complex. A nice one.

33cl bottle from somewhere! Color is dark copper brown black. Thin brownish head. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Medium body. Nice long and tasty finish. Aroma is chcoolate, liquorice, coffee, cacao, spices, vanilla, whisky.

Moja butelka datowana była na kwiecień 2014, więc swoje już odleżała. Muszę przyznać, że nie zaszkodziło to piwu;) Jego torfowość bardzo mocna, intensywna, ale też ułożona i momentami zmienia się w przesympatyczną szynkę (bo kto nie lubi szynki?!). Drewno, nutka szlachetnego alkoholu, paloność, suszone owoce, wanilia, a w tle tytoniowe i popiołowe nutki. To wszystko to jest zamknięte w puszystym i kremowym, oleistym piwie. Brakuje mi tu jedynie większego ciała.

Bottle. Dark brown with a small light tan head. Vanilla, fruit cake, some smoke, strong bread. Really surprisingly thin bodied - sometimes with these Ola Dubhs you wonder how much the whisky adds to Old Engine Oil, here its almost as though its been made with an especially weak version. 3- But theres dark chocolate and bread to support the lovely Highland Park whisky notes, and although the whisky dominates, its not boozy and the flavours are well enough integrated. Not a bad beer but Id come to expect a lot more.

ASPETTO: marrone scurissimo, praticamente nero impenetrabile. Schiuma marroncina, poco abbondante e poco persistente. AROMA: marzapane, passito, liquoroso, caramello. GUSTO: veramente squisita. Si percepisce soprattutto il passito, il maltato, il caramello, il liquoroso, il whisky, questultimo anche nel retrogusto, che presenta appunto una secchezza tipica della bevanda scozzese. Abbondante legnoso. Capolavoro!

Bottle. Dark brown in colour, medium sized beige head. Aroma of dark malts, chocolate, light roastiness, peat, oak, dried fruits. In taste sweet, roasted, woody, peated. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture, alcohol well hidden. Finish has bitter chocolate and some peat.

0.33l bottle, bottle nr 07639 brought home from Whole Foods. Oh, this aroma brings me back many years. Its been way too long once the last time I had a Ola Dubh. Its really deep and dark brown in the glass, initially not much of a head to write home about, then it forms a medium sized deep brown top, quickly fading in to a sidesticking and bubbly thing. Could in other words have looked better. The aroma is filled with lovely whisky. Mild peaty, lots of burnt wood. Its smoky and deep roasted. Yeah, no doubt its a Dubh. Lots of flavor also, but its surprisingly watery. Both in the mouthfeel and in the taste - to my surprise. Its sharp and a tad top boozy imo. No where near the other ice had in the series. Mild dark chocolate and sweet kind of licorice. Whisky and burnt wood. A little disappointed compared to how I remember this series, but still its undoubtedly a lovely Dubh. 24.07.2015

Bottle from Cap Tap. Pours near black with a transient tan head and a chocolate, treacle and whiskey aroma. There is a rich smoked malt flavor with some dark molasses, vanilla and a warm whiskey trail. A nice sipper.

Merci à Guillaume Sigouin pour cette bière de dimanche après-midi dautomne et pluvieux. Je naurais su imaginé meilleur moment pour déguster cette bière légère et réconfortante. Robe brun foncé dont les reflets couleur brique trahissent un procédé de filtration. Peu de mousse et ça me va. Le contraire meût beaucoup étonné. Beaucoup de malts torréfié et de vieux whisky. Un café whisky avec beaucoup moins damertume que dans un café, quoique lamertume nest pas complètement absente non plus. Texture très mince et alcool inexistant. Des fruuts confits se joignent à cette célébration toute en légèreté. Facile à boire, très douce sans piur autant manquer de complexité, un old ale dapéritif idéal.

2016/09/30 - Pours jet black with a small, creamy, khaki colour head that leaves ample lacing. Aroma is chocolate, wood, licorice, prunes, figs, molasses, light smoke and hints of vanilla. Taste is semi sweet chocolate, figs, peat, toffee and woody vanilla. Mouthfeel is light to medium and slick with smooth carbonation and a dry, lightly warming finish. Delicious, flavorful and surprisingly light. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black with a small light beige head. Aroma is raisins, fig, sherry, sweet whisky, prunes, fig. Medium bodied, lightly sticky mouthfeel, sweet on the palate with a lightly astringent, slightly boozy finish. Taste is whisky, fruit cake, prunes, figs, hint of peat, wood, vanilla, sherry.

Pours out muddy dark brown bordering on black. Thin mocha coloured head. On the nose there is smokey black liquorice, whiskey, dark chocolate and raisins. Tastes pretty much identical, with a slight breadiness. This is an outstanding brew. Would gladly buy again.
Sample from a bottle at DØE 2016. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, dried fruit, oak, vanilla, chocolate and whisky peat.

Piana beżowa, drobna, jak na cappuccino, dość trwała. Barwa ciemno brązowa, nieprzejrzysta. W aromacie karmel, melasa, toffi, czekolada, kawa zbożowa, likier waniliowy. W smaku półsłodkie, treściwe, generalnie powtórka z zapachu, może nieco więcej wanilii. Goryczka niska, lekko palona, popiołowa. Alkohol rozgrzewający, w posmakach whisky. Nisko wysycone, gładkie, aksamitne i dość gęste w odbiorze.
Praktycznie niczym nie ustępuje wersji Ola Dubh 18, może minimalnie delikatniejszy aromat i wyraźniejsza whisky w posmaku, ale to nadal to samo świetne leżakowane Old Ale.

Bottle #06316, bottled at April 2014. Almost böack, a brown head is medium but its decreasing quickly. Aroma has salt liquirice, smokey turf, some sweetness of malts. Taste has roastiness, some salt liquirice and smoke, hint of berries. Medium bodied, smooth to drink. Balanced and succesfully beer, the barrel is clearly noticed but its not too dominating.

Aroma: roasted dark malts, peated, whisky barrel, notes.
Appearance: deep brown color and creamy head.
Taste: peated notes, whisky barrel, roasted dark malts, bitter chocolate, dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, peated finish.
Overall: Great beer, complex and peated, drinkable.

330ml bottle from Saveur Biere online. Pours black-brown in colour with a biege foam head leaving lacing and aroma of malt, molasses, toffee, oak, chocolate. Taste is roast malty, dark chocolate, dried fruits, woody oak, vanilla and spicy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry roast bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Aromat: niezbyt wyrazisty, szczerze mówiąc liczyłem na więcej. Nuty ciemnych owoców, gorzkiej czekolady, palność, może nico drewna czy wanilii. Alkohol natomiast bardzo ułożony, praktycznie niewyczuwalny.

Wygląd: barwa czarna, z rubinowymi refleksami pod światło. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, niewielka i dość szybko redukująca się do pierścienia wokół ścianek.

Smak: umiarkowana słodycz, złamana kwaskowością. Sporo owoców w likierze, czekolady gorzkiej, paloności, karmelu. Alkohol początkowo obecny z czasem się także się układa i przestaje piec. Nuty wanilii występują, ale na początku nie są szczególnie wyraźne. Podobny efekt uzyskiwałem dodając whisky do ciemnego piwa. Mam wrażenie, ze młodsi bracia (czy też siostry?) 12-do 18 bardziej do mnie przemawiały. A może już zbyt dużo podobnych piw piłem żeby mnie tak łatwo zaskoczyć. Wypada jednak docenić szczególnie ułożony charakter tego piwa, subtelną goryczkę, gładkość i świetnie ułożony alkohol przy krągłej pełni. To bardzo dobre piwo, ale za zasługi całej serii dodatkowych bonusów nie ma.
Dark brown. Aromas of roasted, peated malt, sweet hints of vanilla. Sweet chocolate malt base with peated malt and whisky casks. Dry, warming finish. Love it.

Best aroma i can recall for a beer. All that time in whiskey barrels has paid off.  Pours black and tan. Soft mouth feel. Vanilla and whiskey flavours blend with the creamy chocolate stout. Complex with more pf the whiskey lingering in the finish.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Aroma: vanilla, oak, chocolate, peat, fruity
Taste: medium sweet, oak, chocolate, roasty, vanilla, peat,
Bottle.Black colour with no head.Aroma is smooth with taste of wood vanilla and roasted malt,flavor is oily with hint of whisky and caramel,full body and creamy finish.

330 ml bottle at home from trade with Douberd. Thanks Christos! Dark brown almost black color with beige head. Malty aroma, roasted, chocolate, dark dried fruits, vanilla, wood, smoked when it gets warmer. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma with some vinous notes. Medium oily body with soft carbonation
Bottle at KØ16. Good vanilla aroma. Black colour, seems cloudy. No head. The flavour is creamy with a good vanilla note. Not too sweet, but well-balanced. Roasted finish.

Bottle, 2014 vintage. Black pour with a small tan head. Aroma is chocolate, cherry, caramel, slight bready notes, a little woody and a touch boozy. Taste is some sweet dark fruit, black cherry, date, raisin, some roasty chocolate and subtle coffee, caramel. Not as thick and rich as expected, but tasty, complex and balanced.

Black with a brown head - Aroma of roasted malt ans ome smoked malt, olso some wood and vanilla notes as well as some hints of whiskey - Good roasted malt body with smokey notes and some wood and vanilla with some alcohol heat in tha back - The roasted and smoked malt goes into the finish with some bitterness and there is some woody notes along with some whiskey and alcohol in the back - This was real good
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are dark malts, chocolate, leather, and some smoke.
Pours a coffee like body with a thin head. Rich aroma of malt and barrels. Rich and full taste of malty flavours like bread, wood and fried fruit.
Bottle. Black pour with a dense beige head. The aroma is roasted with chocolate notes and vanilla from the whisky cask. Peat, roast and chocolate flavor. A bit watery.

Deep brown color, light brown head. Brown sugar nose, whisky, oak, chocolate, roasted malt. Sweet taste, whisky, roasted malt, espresso, oak, sharp notes. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Pours a black colour. Taste is whisky like with some wood and vanilla. Not quite as good as the 18 year old but still a way above average beer

Bottle with the Belgrade Boys at Halloween tasting. Rich, soapy foam. Chocolate covered cherries, great whiskey character. Sweet, smooth. A little more body than 16y/o. Tobacco and peaty smoke. Lovely, tasty, subtle. Not as interesting as the 12y/o in the end though.

Pours opaque sable with a thick and rather persistent tan head. Aroma tempts with strong roast malt, molasses, chocolate, smoky, whisky-soaked wood, and earthy tones. Flavor delivers not quite as much as the aroma, but still pleases - and now the vanilla snippet finally comes forth. Mouthfeel presents firm, viscous body and strong fizz. Worth seeking.
Bottle..Pour is dark black with a tan head..Nose is chocolate, spice, roast, bourbon, oak, musty...Taste is musty, spice, oak, chocolate, dry oak
Nice sipper as expected - leather and tobacco, light smoke booze fruit and chocolate notes. I like all of the Ola Dubhs with this One somewhere in the middle.

Black body, barly any head. In this version the wood barrel is the main aroma, vanilla, caramel, slightly peaty and smoky. Flavours of caramel, wood, vanilla, fusel alcohol, smoky and peaty. Medium woody finish. Oily body, low carbo. Better than the 18yr but I still prefer the 12yr.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

26th November 2015Scopey 10K Celebrations in deepest Croydonia. Thanks to Matteo. Almost opaque dark brown beer, small pale tan head. Smooth palate, a little dry. Mild carbonation. Bitterish dark malts with equally bitterish dark chocolate. Tangy dark fruits. Some cream sweetness provides relief. Some sherry soaked fruits. Dry finish. Not bad.

Bottle 0.33l at The Halloween tasting 2015 Belgrade Serbia.Taste at Beerville Bar with our small tasting group.Bro Vlada, Bro Alberto and Bro Matt.Bottle from the Great British festival.Pour it dark color with small white head.Aroma of dark red fruits and vanilla.Taste light pleasent start of whiskey, after smokey, finish kick of alcohol,nice and pleasent.Ok balanced.

330 ml bottle shared with crew. Pours an orange tinted black with a short lived beige head. Aroma is chocolate, salt, peat and smoke. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, peat, salt, oldish, wood. Finish is salty, smoky, peaty. Light to medium body, weak carbonation.

Black pour with surprisingly decent one finger brown head. Indistinguishable in appearance from the others sampled at the same time. All had the same basic notes of licorice, tar, tabacco, and leather. This one was significantly smoother and more well rounded than the other ones. Note exactly my idea of an amazing beer, but definitely my favorite of the bunch.
Tasting at my place. Zacht, diep, gebalanceerd. Chocolade, vanille ijs, donkere vruchten, (verbrand) hout, whisky. Dun laagje stof over de smaak. Smullen geblazen. Backlog from 2015/05/26.

pours hazy light brown with a small light beige cap offering minimal retention and lacing. roasted maltiness - burnt caramel, lots of toasted/roasted hazelnuts, leather, gently smokiness, minerals. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; semi-sweet woodsy-spicy finish. very nice wooden integration - complex roasted maltiness.

Pretty good. Small tan head. Aroma is dark malt, really good smoked ham, not much else. Flavors like nose, plus a little carbonic tang and the same amount of malt sweetness. Not quite balanced. Decent finish. Wouldnt say its an easy drinking beer, but you dont have to exactly worry about it either.

Bottle shared at Scopeys 10K, thanks Matteo! Bottled April 2014, #04576. Black, small foamy tan head. Aroma is molasses, soft whisky, red berry, melted dark chocolate and a little chilli. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is whisky, oaky, vanilla, chocolate, dry woody finish. Very nice.

33cl bottle spli at Pauls 10k tasting, London. It pours a dark brown color with small beige head. Aroma is cocoa chocolate and dusty. Taste is light sweet cocoa chocolate light grains am booze and vanilla. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, ok

Bottle big thanks to MattyO. It pours near black with a small tan head. The nose is bitter-sweet, oily, fruit cake, whisky, honeycomb, plum, fruit cake, jammy berry and candy. The taste is bitter-sweet, toasty, fruit compote, earth, some chewy sweetness, charred wood, sweet whisky, oily and some warmth with a a dry, toasty finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well-rounded and pretty easy. A touch sweet if anything, but good anyways.

Bottle split at Scopey 10K, thanks to Matteo, 26/11/15.
Light black with a decent tan covering. 
Nose is rich dark fruit, spice, cocoa powder, toffee, dark malt.
Taste comprises light peated notes - pretty subtle, chocolate malt, whisky barrel, toffee fudge, sweet and sour, toasted brown sugar. 
Medium + bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a tickle of booze.
Decent olde.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle no. 07753, on APRIL 2014 with a best before date MAY 2017. Pours a real dark black-brown colour with deep ruby highlights. The head is a decent size, mocha-coloured with some good retention and lacing. Sweet aromas of caramel, butterscotch. All of this over the roasted malts, mild hops, smoked wood and dark fruits. The taste is not as sweet showing more the roasted malts. The hops are a little more present adding some bitterness. Light wood and peatiness lingers. Another good one.

Bottle to pint glass
Unbaked bread, yeast, malt, and peat. Black with a thin tan head. Peat, roasted malt, dark chocolate, whiskey, clove.
Bottle from halls. pours black with a very thin tan head. The aromas are chocolate, coffee, musk. The mouthfeel is dry and bitter with a roastiness and heavy body and medium carbonation. Cheers!

Bière complètement noir qui quand ont à verse dans le vert fait vraiment penser à un impérial stout
Au nez on va sentir des notes alcoolique, le whisky, la tourbe ,les céréales, le réglisse
Bouche elle va être très fine et légère puis une amertume assez puissante arrive va sentir des notes de whisky et légèrement afin de bouche le réglisse
Bière complètement meilleur par rapport à la 12 la 16 ou la 18 
Mets dans le même genre jen ai vu des bien meilleur( peut-être le taux dalcool qui est un peu trop faible pour ce genre de bière)
Smell of tar, oak, whisky. Black colour, tiny dark brown head. Aroma of whisky, oak, coffee, licorice, tar. Medium bitter, lightly oily texture. Carbon is flat and soft. Slightly watery.
Very dark Brown with a small White head. Aroma is whiskey, wood and malt. Taste is whiskey, sugar and coffee.

(Harviestoun Ola Dubh (21 Year Old)) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a teku, ABV 8%
Pitch black colour on the body, small and thin beige head on top, with low retention.
Aroma of chocolate, whiskey, light peat, prunes, iodium.
Taste has toffee, chocolate, roasted malts, whisky, light peat, wood, well hidden alcohol.
Medium body, soft carbonation. 
Great.

Pours less viscous than expected to small shortlived greige head over sepia-black beer. Old shoes, wood, faint whisky/alcohol/fusels, bit nutty. Woody, tannines, bitterish on sweet underbuild, whisky, liquorice with (almost) no sweetvector, burnt. Not really thick, if somewhat viscous, bit undercarbonated. For some unfathomable reason (tired casks?) much less spectacular than the other Ola Dubhs...

At the Belgrade-Serbia tasting on 31/10/2015. Bottle shared by markoijelena, many thanks. Pours black color with a minimal ivory foam, only lacing after a blink. Nose: deep and strong vanilla flavor, cherries, some smoked notes. Mouth: watery, frizzy finish with a bit of a peppery final. Rich whiskey taste with alcohol prominent notes.

Bottle. Pours an oily, rich, opaque brown-black with a light brown ring head. Nose is coffee, baking chocolate, raisin, date, smoke, peat, saline, and roast pecans. Amazingly gentle for as rich as it is; the mouthfeel is silken, the smoke, coffee, chocolate, and peat well integrated and subtle. Theres some sweetness, but very little fruit; the whisky comes through on the back of the palate, but its mature, softer, calm. Still, though, it remains definitely there. The finish is long, elegant, and perfect. Rapturous.

Bottle @ Deyhollas. Deep brown with red highlights. Tiny tan head. Ink, toasted bread. Burnt wood. Loads of ash. Mild peat and earthy richness. Some cocoa. Taste is salted dark chocolate. Mild peat. Very rich and oily. Some brown sugar. Great.

Bottle shared by Jack, thanks! Pours black with a dark brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount of roasted malts and chocolate with some sweet dark grains and a bit of peat. Flavor has sweet dark grains, chocolate and roasted malts with a growing peat note.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt vanille, crème, koffie, beetje peated. Smaakt vol vanille, koffie, peated, beetje crème.
De laatste in het rijtje. Veel minder sterke geur dan de drie uit jongere vaten. Weer wat meer alcohol in de smaak, jammer..
Donker rood bruin bier met een goede beige schuim kraag. Ruikt vanille, overrijp fruit. Smaakt zacht, vanille, geroosterd, overrijp fruit.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2015 Degustée après 17 mois. Robe noire presque opaque avec de minces reflets acajou. Arômes de café, léger whisky, chocolat noir. Nez très léger, presque décevant. En bouche, grains de café torréfiés, mélasse. Le whisky, très doux, se mêle à des effluves de chocolat noir juste assez amères. Finale plus chocolatée, un peu boisée. Pas mal mais les saveurs manquent dintensité. La texture est assez légère pour ce genre de bière et le corps est plutôt mince. Sans compter le rapport qualité/prix qui est à revoir.

33 cl bottle. Bottle No. #11869. Bottled on 04/2014.
Pours black color with a small off-white head. Licorice all around on the nose, ripe fruit notes, dry dark malts and some faint rye. Flavor has licorice, burnt malts, ash and subtle cocoa notes. A bit disappointing.
4324

330 ml bottle. Pours a black colour with a minimal white head. Aroma of roasted malts, licorice, whickey and wet earth. Flavour of roastiness, saltiness, soy sauce, tart wood, whiskey, peat and bitterness. Chocolate notes. Medium bodied. Quite dry mouthfeel. Finishes with heavy peaty notes and chocolate. The wooden notes are rather overwhelming. Not my kind of a beer.

330ml bottle from De Molen Beershop

Pours pitch black with a bubbly head. Aroma of roasty malts, oak, wood, whisky, peat, chocolate and toffee. Taste is smooth, slick and slightly roasty with some oak, wood, whisky, vanilla and peat. Finish is smooth, oaky and woody with some vanilla, peat and whisky. Okay.

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 05/2017. Bottle #11869, April 2014.
Aroma has sweet whiskey tones, licorice and smoke. Flavour has licorice, smoke, ash, soy sauce and some odd plastic element. Also some rubbery elements. Straightforward, slightly harsh and a bit disappointing.
Bottle at home, 18th September 15. Pours black, slight head. Aroma is peat, wood, whiskey. Taste is fairly rich, whiskey forward, some smoke, peat, slight spice, liquorice. Very enjoyable.

Nip bottle. Thanks, J! Damn, what a cool treat. I probably would have bought it if you hadnt, so thanks for sharing. Pours an opaque and slightly grainy ebony, nearly black. Dense and creamy burnt tan head that falls away fairly rapidly. Big sweet nose, showing caramel and vanilla and maybe a hint of butterscotch, lots of roasty peat and high-percentage dark chocolate mixed in as well. Thick, creamy, nearly still body. Coats the mouth, coats the palate, which perfectly suits the depth and intense explosiveness of the flavors. Caramel, vanilla, roast, peat, and dark chocolate on the mid palate. A rare treat and well worth savoring intently.

Bottle - Dark molasses, roast, chocolate and toffee. Jet black with a rich light brown head. Tons of wood and whisky notes. Raw wood prevails and unfortunately the beer is lost. Not enough balance in the taste and a bit thin at that.
Shared 0,33l bottle @ Thalians place. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with some notes of whisky and sherry. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, coffee and whisky. Nice.
Svart farve med beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, lakris, sjokolade og whiskey. Smak av røstet malt, lakris, sjokolade og whiskey. Melkebaren.

deep dark, almost black colour, moderate sized, beautiful, creamy brown head; aroma of coffee, some chocolate, vanilla, whisky, and woody notes, taste of whisky, some smokey notes, roastedness and syrup; great beer
Wel weer lekker maar toch wat tegenvallend na alle andere varianten. Misschien te te veel sigaren gerookt :-) binnenkort alle ola dubhs eens naast elkaar proeven. ..

Lukt: Kaffe, lakris og sjokolade.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Kaffe, sjokolade og lakris.

chocolate and light smoked aroma,black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, Wood and light smoked finish.
Dark brown, almost black. Has a light-brown head, medium duration. Dark aroma, malts, faint smoke and vanilla.
UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Pours black with beige head. Aroma is roasted, wood, whisky, licorice. Flavour is roasted, licorice, medium sweet, light bitter, wood and notes of whisky.

[7204-20150501] 330mL bottle. Earthy wooden peat moss aroma. Black body with a quick foamy tan head. Charred woody earth and roasted bread flavour. Medium-full body. Good. (8/3/8/4/15) 3.8
(w/ jercraigs, mds)

Appearance: stout-like--near black, with a short, creamy, tan head and some light lace rings.  Aroma: chocolate, coffee, molasses, graham crackers, vanilla, light smoke and wood.  Taste: 	dark chocolate, roasty dark coffee, sweet vanilla and whiskey, with charred wood and a little peat underneath.  Finish: lingering whiskey-vanilla sweetness over bittersweet dark chocolate. Notes: 	Really nice. I love Old Engine Oil, and the barrel aging for this was spot on. Bottle from Sarah for Beerthday 2015.

Bottle from ABV. Pours a murky black color with brown shades, a medium light brown head. A big sweet barrel nose, smoke, chocolates, some ash. The flavor is smoke, peat, light hot whiskey, some chocolate and milky stotu base. Woody, musty, a very soft palate but a sharp sweet hot whiskey base. Very nice. Id like this on cask, it would be heavenly.

Fra flaske på sesongens siste M2, Cardinal juni-15: brunsvart med kort beige skum. Sjokolade, kaffe, vanilje og whisky i aroma og smak, og den lille bærsyrligheten kompletterer balansen - so smooth. Farlig lettdrikkelig.
Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours black, no head. Aroma is mild and subtle, dark thick malts. Taste is moderate sweet, malty with notes of liquorice and tar, lovely round mouthfeel, nice.

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 15.06.15. Almost black. Diminishing pale brown head. Aroma of black malt, dark chocolate and vanilla. Similar taste, also with a hint of cigar box and star anise. Fine aftertaste.

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours dark brown with small brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, whiskey. Taste sweet with some fruity and roasted notes. Quite an easily drinkable beer.

Pours dark and oily with foamy beige head. Nose is roasted malt and some hints of chocolate and coffee. Taste is sweet and malty and you can definitly taste the casks and the whisky. Carbonation is slightly low but Overall a very good beer! The aftertaste is awesome. After one Minute or so all that lasts is the peat and you could think you just had a shot of Great highland Park... Love it...
(bottle) lear, bright dark brown colour with a small brown head; rich aroma of wet wood, brown sugar, whiskey; lean, balanced flavour

28 May 2015, bottle. black. nose is pungent; toasted malt, strong alcohol, tobacco, bread. med body and moderately fizzy. very woody, sweet, dry bread, toasted malt, tobacco, slightly acidic, grainy, woody. big but almost bland. i think ive had better old dubhs than this.

Bottle 330ml @ Sommerhus
Pours dark brown with a few off-white bubbles. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, oak, alcohol, biscuit and smoke. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long warm, biscuit, caramel and oak finish: Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle shared. Black with small beige head thats mainly some big bubbles. Licorice, soft smoky wood, light whisky, caramel, vanilla, roasted nuts. Quite soft and subtle earth, peat, disintegrated wood, syrup. Very nice and complex aromas work well with the light sweetness and soft roasted bitter finish. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Great, the best of the series for me so far.

330 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 8%. Pitch black colour, moderate to low tan head. Very nice aroma of oak, vanilla, chocolate, coffee and whisky. Medium dry flavour, notes of oak, tar, ashes, whisky, smoke, coffee, vanilla and dark chocolate. Good stuff.

April 2014 bottle. Pours black with a ring of off-white head. Aroma is mild with hints of dark chocolate, caramel, dark fruits, toffee, and oak. Taste is balanced. Touches of dark malts, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, peat smoke, whisky, and a mildly bitter ending. Medium body with a low carbonation. Clean texture with a bone dry finish. Overall an interesting beer. Not as big as I was expecting but well done. Couldnt tell it was 8%. Very well rounded.

10.05.2015, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Small light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is mild and slightly sweet, caramel, leather, dark malts, oak, chocolate, coffee, nuts, grass, grain, hints of peat. Taste is slightly dry, hay, peat, dark malts, leather, sour coffee, caramel, minerals, oak, weeds. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice enough.

2015-05-01. Black body with a small tan head. 3+ Aroma of alcohol and dark malt. Sweetish core balances against the dryness of the alcohol. Whisper of peat and whiskey. Flavour is similar. Dark malt core, moderate whisky tang throughout. Surprisingly restrained and mild actually. Not to my taste but a nicely made beer. Better than some of the others in the series, at least for me. Bottle from the LCBO.
Dark almost black color with mocha-colored head. Aroma of dark fruit, wood and vanilla. Taste is soft and complex with hints of peat, wood, vanilla and chocolate.

Bottle. Almost black in color, tan head. Notes of peat, sweetish chocolate and dark fruityness in aroma. Just awesome. Some campfire is present too. Chocolate and cocoacoffee with notes of whiskey in taste. Quite smooth mouthfeel. Bit of fine grainy notes and salty licorice in aftertaste. Had my doubts, but seems like an excellent sauna beer as well.

330ml bottle. Dark brown with a frothy beige head. Flavors are chocolate, smoke, soy sauce, licorice, alcohol, caramel, vanilla and peat with fruity and oaky notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture.

Pitch black with a beige-toast coloured pillowy head. Aromas of roasted chocolate malts, roast coffee beans, cocoa nibs, wood and earthy vanilla notes as well as hints of caramelised nuts with alcohol aromatic raisins. Very softly carbonated with a slick even oily light velvety texture and a full elegant body. Malt vanilla fudge sweetness with a pinch of wooden smokeyness and a bitter chocolate flavour note. Medium lasting finish. Harmonic and highly palatable.

330 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a tulip glass. 
App.: Deep brown-black with a fair dark tan head.
 
Aroma: Lots of nice peaty smokiness with plenty of rich malt support that comes in as molasses, dark chocolate, light licorice, black coffee (sort of...).
 
Palate: Medium-full body, soft, elegant carbonation.
 
Flav.: Much like the nose, there is a lot of nice scotch smoke with a great malty backbone, lots of molasses, chocolate, vanilla; sweet with moderate bitterness and a very smoky and rich/dark malty finish.

Pretty nice and a good price.

Bottle: Poured a dark brown color ale with a medium size light brown foamy head with good retention and some light lacing notes. Aroma of light scotch notes with some toffee and light brown sugar notes is quite enticing. Taste is also dominated by toffee notes with some residual candi sugar balanced against some great scotch notes. Body is maybe thinner than I would have expected with some good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Not as complex as I was expecting but still very enjoyable.

It pours opaque black; the head is beige and foamy. The aroma has notes of: cracker, charcoal, liquorice, and espresso. The taste light sweet that finishes medium bitter; there are notes of: charcoal, dark chocolate, wet wood, and slight anise. The palate is medium - full bodied; little carbonation, and oily; and a medium finish. Overall, definitely not worth the price.

330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a dark chestnut brown with thin light tan head. Aroma is a nice balance of barrel and beer with solid vanilla, scotch, dark fruit and chocolate. Flavour is big on scotch character, some sweet dark fruit, chocolate, peat and barrel. A little thinner than I might have expected, though certainly not thin in absolute terms. Nice.

March 25, 2015. Bottle at home, bottled april 2014. 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is chocolate, oak, tobacco, plum, light whiskey and peat notes. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter roasted notes, oak, tobacco and light peat. Medium bodied, average carbonation.
Very nice...boozy and woody with a great smokiness. Very dry finish. I liked this a lot... but just a hair more than the 12 year, and for the price...thats not worth it.

Une bouteille #00869, avril 2014 may 2017. Un liquid noire avec une mousse brune. Un nez complexe deffluves de trucs noirs comme du chocolat, de café. Il y a présence de malt fumé et de scotch whiskey. Une superbe bouche piquante de chocolat, réglisse, café et malt fumé. Jaime cette bière.

Jet black, small beige head. huge barrel aroma, lots of scotch notes, quite woody, and earthy with subtle sweet fruit, and big roasted malts. Oily, thick mouth feel, almost no carb. The finish is medium bitter, with alot of roast and a dry woody, earthy barrel.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours black with low beige head. Very nice lacing. Aroma is of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate. Taste is of roasted malt, ashes, chocolate, coffee. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Good. Nice malt features. Strong liquor features.

330 mL bottle. Looks like the others. Markedly more barrell effects on this one than on the 16 and 18, without the depth of the 30 and 40. Having said that, it is not meant as a criticism. Its a good beer.

33cl bottle at home. Dark Black pour with a small mocha ring. Dark cacao, toffee, oak, smoke, coffee, caramel malts, small peat hint (weakest peat taste of the pack) bit of a weak mouthfeel, some vanilla, red fruits. Not as good as the 18 year version
Very dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma of malts, whisky, smoke, peat. Taste is light to medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Nice.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Harviestoun Ola Dubh (21 Year Old) ].Clear dark red brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, peat, wood, oak. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, roasted - wood bitter, roasted, chocolate, malt sweet, woody - peated. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat, finish feel is light light alcoholic. [20141227]

Bottle (330 ml). Bottled in 2014. Split 3-ways.

Appearance: Dark brown with reddish reflects, a small ring of brown foam and little to no lacing. 

Aroma: Peated whiskey (dominant), smoke, chocolate, light caramel, hints of fruits and vanilla notes.

Taste: Quite peated whiskey forward along smoke, iodine, chocolate, light caramel and light fruitiness. Oak too.

Palate: Medium body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Oaky. Warming finish. 

Overall: Tasty, but a bit unbalanced because of the strong peated whisky presence. The beer seems to lack a bit of body to handle the barrel treatment properly. Im curious to try the other versions.

330 ml bottle into snifter; bottle # 05043, bottled in 4/2014. Pours fairly pitch black color with a 1 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of chocolate, cocoa, toast, dark bread, leather, tobacco, peat smoke, oak, light dark fruit, and roast/smokey earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of roast/bready malt and scotch barrel notes; with good strength. Taste of big chocolate, cocoa, toast, dark bread, leather, tobacco, peat smoke, oak, light dark fruit, light vanilla, and roast/smokey earthiness. Light roast/oaky bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, cocoa, toast, dark bread, leather, tobacco, peat smoke, oak, light dark fruit/vanilla, and roast/smokey earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice balance, complexity, and robustness of roast/bready malt and scotch barrel flavors; with a nice roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, fairly creamy, and lightly chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent old ale style. All around great complexity and balance of roast/bready malt and scotch barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on. An interesting note about this vintage is it is much bolder on peat smoke and earthy leather/tobacco notes than the younger scotch vintages. A very enjoyable offering.

Bière très mince mais proposant beaucoup de saveurs. Cest vraiment très gourmant au nez : chocolat et guimauve dominent clairement la danse. En bouche, la fête sucrée se poursuit mais sans tomber dans lexcès. Le corps très mince limite cependant lappréciation. Lalcool est absolument indétectable et aide à produire une bière qui se boit vraiment très bien.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2015 Pours a dark brown with a small beige rim that leaves fair lacing. Nose is of smoke, peated scotch, chocolate and coffee. Taste is of slight iodine, smoky like expected and chocolate-y. Moderately sweet. Lots of wood. Body is light to medium, carbonation somewhat high and alcohol shows a bit. Overall a good barrel-aged porter-ish beer! Barrel aging is not in your face like american equivalents and classy.

0,33 l bottle 
roasty, woody, vanilla, toast, herbs, earthy, black, hazy, minimal head, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

Bouteille No 00874. Avril 2014. Meilleure avant 2017. Robe presque noire plus ou moins épaisse et sur laquelle se place un anneau de mousse qui meurt avec une certaine tranquillité. Au nez, fumée de tourbe, chocolat ou plutôt mélasse ou fudge en friandise et petits fruits foncés comme des mûres ou des raisins et cette assez belle présence dune vanille ou de quelque chose qui peut sapparenter à de la guimauve. En bouche, une fumée chargée de réglisse et de chocolat qui sévapore à travers la peau dun raisin qui trempe dans un whiskey aux consonances boisées et iodées. Au palais, une impression corporelle plutôt et étonnamment mince avec une texture à la limite crémeuse et un pétillement modéré à bas. Une finale de scotch rendue amère par cette fumée du bord de mer.

Bottle (33cl): No.#11690/April 2014: Served in a Chouffe glass at 14 degrees Celsius:
Small vast/thick beige head on top of a black beer.
Aromas of smooth whiskey notes, chocolate, oatmeal, mocha, soft roast tone, hints of bay leaf, peat and wood.
Flavours of vanilla, mocha, smooth whiskey notes, chocolate, smooth roast, bitters, some caramel, light peat and light smoke.
Aftertaste is a mix of mocha, bitters, smooth roast, chocolate, light peat.
Low carbo, light creamy mouthfeel, more than medium bodied.
Very smooth beer.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Old Ale, Bottle #3182, april 2014. schenkt zwart met mooie bruine kraag. Aroma van gebrande mouten, chocolade, koffie, toffee, whisky, vanille. Smaken zijn redelijk zoet, matig bitter, zeer sterk, donkere fruiten, sterke moutigheid van gebrande en geroosterde mout, toffe, chocoalde, vanille, whisky, caramel. iets scherps maar verder héérlijk. medium body, romig van textuur, uitstekend bier !

Bottled from Systembolaget
Black with a small, tan head. 
Wooden aroma with some vanilla and coconut. 
Rather light body and sweet.
Wooden flavour with vanilla. A bit vinous.

Nearly black, seems clear. Tiny offwhite head. Aroma has wood, chocolate, peat, smoke and dark sugar. Flavour is peaty, smoked with warming alcohol. Brown sugar and syrup, strong whisky notes. Sticky, boozy finish. Really nice.

Dark brown with a small beige head. Whisky-like aroma with peat and tar, and hints of cocoa. The whisky is there in the taste as well, smokey, sweet, some cocoa and coffee notes. Medium body, low-medium carbonation. Long, peaty finish, alcohol, leather. Nice one.

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a deep mahogany with a frothy off white head. The aroma is roasted malt, light vanilla caramel, liqourice. The flavour is strong bitter with a rich oily, malty, chocolate, light coffee, light alcoholic palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation. I was a baby when that whisky was first distilled...well, in my dreams at least. Everything is relative eh :-)

Bottle from web SB cons 2015-01-11 Duved
AR: fruity peatiness, wee tar, chocolate
AP: dark brown, wee stouty brown deminshing head
F: fizzy, peaty fruitiness, tar, hollow - watery thin feeling, bitter finish, dry, wee tobaco and leather,

small bubbly head dark mahogany pour near black mild carbonation aromas alcohol dates molasses caramel chocolate raisin syrup cocoa flavours peat cocoa the whiskey influence could be better always seems watery like in taste some raisin mild syrup molasses chocolate a dryness the finish best tastes fruits dark malts okay but other aged of the type have been better

Bottle shared at Craigs. Pours clear, amber-brown with a light, creamy tan head. Nice aroma with kicks of peat smoke, earth, mild cocoa. Medium sweet flavor with oily, peaty character, some baking cocoa, scorched earth. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Nice peaty finish with further char, bitter cocoa. Solid stuff. Highly drinkable.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks DSG. Pours brown to black with a beige head, aroma of smoke, coffee, chocolate, iodine, caramel, toffee, flavor of iodine, coffee, chocolate, caramel, toffee, peat and whiskey, medium bodied.

Bottle from Beersiveknown, many thanks Steve.  Almost black color with medium beige head. Surprisingly mild aroma of roasted malt, coffee, alcohol. Coffee dominates the taste, complemented with vanilla, milk chocolate, light notes of peat, whiskey, wood. Tasty.

Bottle at home from Cuso (and Beersiveknown), many thanks for this one. Pours black color, small dark beige head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla, whiskey, chocolate, some alcohol. Taste is sweet, lightly bitter, coffee, whiskey, vanilla, roasted malt, peated, chocolate, warming alcohol. Nice sweet coffee finish with lot of alcohol.
33 cL bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted dark malty and chocolate. Sweet, chocolate and slight vanilla. Toasted malty and lingering dark malty finish.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Almost black with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, dark chocolate, wood and light peated. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish with a little warming alcohol. Oily. 271214
Bottle @ Højbjerg juletasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are vanilla, wood, roast malt, chocolate and peat.

Bottle, 8%. Almost black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little whisky and a litlte liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, whisky, peat, medium sweet, hop, notes of vanilla and medium bitter.

Very dark brown with a small creamy tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, wood, dark chocolate, little dark fruit, light smoke. Flavor is malt, light smoke, peat, dark chocolate, caramel, ittle whiskey. Medium body, soft carbonation, light warming alcohol in the finish. 271214

Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Almost Black colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Rasin notes. Moderate bitter flavor. Some oeasted whisky notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Nice.

So this is a pretty nice brew but holy moldy monkeys is this stuff pricey! $18 a glass. but I went the s maller route .. . Black .. Medium to low foam ..,rich far and smooth peat.. A lot going on .. Not as velvety as the other Dubhs though .. . . Bye Jo & Doug, Im gonna miss those one sided hugs Jo!

Beer tasting @ Havregatan 21/12-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Chocolatey, cacao, notes of vanilla, whisky and wood. Taste: Dito + sweetness. Body is medium, the finish is dry with notes of chocolate.

@ Havregatan 141221. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty and fruity with chocolate and vanilla, wood, whisky and dried fruits, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is fruity with chocolate.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dancing Camel Florentin. Black with a nice tan head. Aroma of whiskey, peat, oak, roast, cocoa and some dark fruits. Mildly sweetish flavor with malt, whiskey, some peat, some dark chocolate, a bit of dark fruits and some oak. Medium to full-bodied. Good, but not one of the best versions of Ola Dubh.

33cl bottle at home. Very dark brown with no head. Medium to full body with low carbonation. Nice sweetness combined with a well balanced subtle bitterness. Dark chocolate, whisky, peat, vanilla, raisin, coffee, caramel, spices and herbs.
Wow! This is a very tasty experience that actually gave me goosebumps.

Bottle from systembolaget. Aroma has clear tones of whiskey, some malts and dark chocolates. Pours black with a small brown head. Taste has heavy malts, subtle taste of whiskey and some smokiness. Palate is surprisingly and disappointingly thin. Overall a real treat, definitely worth a try.

Aroma: Smelling of bread, figs, chocolate and vanilla.Appearance: A dark brown colored beer. A low tan head with some lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting nuts, bread, chocolate, oak and vanilla.Palate: Low carbonation, a soft and oily texture. A big body with a slightly dry finish.Overall: Smooth, complex, nice.Note: Bottle #03819, 330 ml at home. Reviewed 2014-12-05.

Dark brown, nice bit of lacing on the filmy head here. Bright, brassy whisky here. More soily, earthy, creamy and choc. Creamier nutty. Lighter whisky but a tangent of bitterness. Finishes a little tarter, smoky and wholesomeBottle, Flu Jab Tasting
Bottle. Black with light tan head. Aroma is roasty, some smokiness. Taste of molasses, chocolate, roast. Smooth and balanced.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2015 bottle at home .. deep black ... thin tan lacing ... soft chocolate malts .. deep black .. thin tan lacing ... sofr chocolate malts ... light roast .. big berry fruit .. dark malts .. dark malts .. soft chocolate roast ,, mellow and round balanced  bottle at home .. deep black ,,, thin tan lacing ... sofft chocolate .. soft roast ... soft malt nose ... dark fruits ... dark malts ... soft chocolate ...light whisky ...nice3.9
Bottle at Craigs. Pours dark brown with a thin tan head. Aromas of whisky, light chocolate. Taste is whisky, boozy, chocolate. Finishes a bit thin, but decent.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black, nose is light chocolate and smoke, taste is dry, light smoke, some chocolate, whisky.

Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, chocolate, whiskey, muscovado sugar, vanilla. Taste is chocolate, whiskey, peat, muscovado sugar, dark chocolate, slight vanilla notes. Mouthfeel is quite smooth with medium carbonation.

Svart med ett ganska litet och brunt skum som snabbt försvinner. Doft: Kola, kaffe, malt, rök, söt fat doft, gräddsås. Smak: Malt, trä, rök, kola, kakao, vanilj, gräddkola, godis med mild kaffe smak, milt av whisky.

11.2 ounce bottle, bottle #02468, April 2014. Served in a snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about a half inch tan head. Head retention and lacing are both good. Aroma is nice, the brew smells like peaty smoke, dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, and some vanilla. I think the taste is pretty much just like the aroma, but theres also a bit of iodine and dark bread noticeable too. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its creamy and coating with moderate carbonation. Its very smooth and easy to drink. If you like Scotch Whisky (and especially peaty ones), then youll probably like this a lot, too. Truthfully, all of the Ola Dubh series brews Ive had have been good, too bad this isnt made in bombers! Definitely worth trying.
Svart farge med tynt beige skum. Lukter sjokolade, alkohol, mørke stenfrukter. Fyldig med sjokolade og vanilje i smak. Fin balansert avslutning. Noe alkoholvarme.
Svart med tynt lavt lys brunt skum. Sjokolade, trevirke, sviske, vanilje og noe røyklukt. Smaker salt lakris og bittersøt brent karamell. Fyldig.

Pours dark dark brown with low off white head
Aromas of whisky, german sausage, tar, soy, swedish brown bread
Taste has nice subtle notes of whisky, hints of peated malts, soy, brown bread. Wee bit watery body

Bottle. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty whisky and caramel aroma. Slightly roasted malty caramel and whisky woody flavor. Has a slightly roasted malty woody whisky and caramel finish.

(330ml bottle) dark black pour, fine tan bubbles. Nose is rich and filled with chocolate, brown sugar,,marshmallow and more but the body and taste are thinner. Chocolate, scotch/whiskey, light peat and thin body finish this out.

Bottled:Pours black with a mid sized head.Aroma is tar, peat, iodine and a little bit of chocolate.Smooth mouth feel.Taste is tar, licorice, iodone, grass and alcohol.Pretty good, but will probably improve with age.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma is quite mellow and controlled but with coffee, chocolate, light peat. Taste is balanced sweet, vanilla and chocolate, followed by a mellow peaty lingering finish. Body is medium rich and somewhat creamy. Nice but not exceptional.

330ml brown bottle with a foil sealed top and a small pamphlet hanging on the neck, label states bottling date April 2014, bottle number 03800, poured into a snifter glass. Appearance is opaque brownish black with a small brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, smoke and vanilla. Flavour of rye sourdough bread, roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee and a hint of whiskey. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, smooth texture and low carbonation. Overall a a tasty well balanced beer.
Bottle @ home 20141008. Aroma of peat smoke, vanilla, chocolate, dark fruits. Taste is rounded with vanilla, peat smoke, plums, toffee and some alcohol. Full body, very well balanced.

Couleur noire, mousse beige qui disparait. Nez boisé de fut de whisky, chêne et café léger, bonne amertume. Gout intense de café léger grillé, chêne et malt, note de figues, et vanille.Un peu huileurse mais bien ronde et légère en bouche malgré lalcool Super

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared with Dutchdrebus. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized light brown head that lasts for quite a while and leaves good lacing. Aroma is malts, lightly sweetish, a touch of dark chocolate. Taste malts, some liquor, liquorice, slightly sweet. Medium body, low carbonation. Hmm a but disappointed with this one. Decent beer but I expected more.
Bottle @benzai. Black colour with a small light brown head. Smells liquorice, roasty, sweet. Mostly liquorice. Tastes roasty, chocolate, sweet, hint of bourbon, nice! Medium body, low carbo.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a small tan head that leaves very little lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, cocoa, vanilla, and very subtle hints of smoke - with a slightly bitter finish.

On tap at OEC. Pours near black with a lacy, beige head. Aroma of roasted and light chocolate malts, oak and whiskey, some light coffee notes, some caramel sweetness, and light dough. Flavor the same with a nice blend of the barrels and the dark beer. Smoother texture. A solid beer.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter black with a thin head.
Aroma is peaty dark fruited & sweetness.
Flavor is classic Ola Dubh. Harviestoun is an icon with this brew. Had so many vintages aged in many Highland Park whiskey barrels. This one is classic with the balance of flavors. Laying the 2nd bottle down.

Poured from a April 2014 bottle into a snifter. Appearance is black like old motor oil with a small tan head that dissipates rapidly. Taste is dark chocolate, peat, and whiskey. Aroma is similar. Palate is nice and smooth. Overall very good though I assume as with the other Ola Dubh beers this will improve with age. Cheers.

Bottle at home courtesy of the brewery, cheers Ewan!Dark brown, tan sticky lacing. Coconut and red berries on nose. Medium bodied and light carbonation. Sweet, fruity, vanilla, dry wood, Slightly whisky, malty, warming but not boozy with a long coconut malty finish.

American Craft Beer Week! On tap at World of Beer SMU. Poured an opaque black with a razor thin khaki top. Taste mostly of the barrel flavors with notes of bourbon, oak, vanilla esters, and roasted malts. Medium carbonation, medium-thick body.

This beer provides the illusion it was aged 21 years but its only a few weeks old. It pours so dark brown you cant see through it and the alcobolic thin head is deep tan and lasts. The aroma is alcohol, sugar, plum, and roasted malt. The body is thick, flavor dominated by cocoa and alcohol with burning vanilla and alcohol soaked oak. Pretty much a bad joke.
On tap at Mr Dunderbaks. Sweet, whiskey, milk chocolate, light vanilla, roasted malt and smoke. Interesting, but too much whiskey for my tastes. 7.0

On tap to a snifter at the Beer Kitchen. Pours jet black with a small, creamy tan head. Aroma is roasted coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, scotch, with some earthiness. Flavor is dark malt, bittersweet chocolate, coffee, some spicy/peppery alcohol taste and a little peatiness. Full body with a creamy, round mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 I liked this a bit better than the 16 year. Sweeter than I expected. Flavors of rich dark chocolate, raspberries, vanilla, whiskey and cherries. Rich wood, caramel, licorice and nuts balance well wiyh the other flavors. Frothy texture and heavy bodied to hold the complex flavors well.

Tap at Maxs. Pours opaque black with a small, creamy tan head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is roast and chocolate malt, light coffee notes, prunes and licorice, spicy alcohol, earthy hops and leather. Flavor is dark malt dominant with light hops and bitterness, molasses, dates, figs, and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.
Rich dark chocolate colour, wonderful aroma of smoked malt, a smoked malt taste reminiscent of a single malt scotch. The smoked malt scotch flavor lasts on the palate.

12 oz. bottle, pours black with a tiny tan head - looks like a stout. Nose brings out deep dark roasted malt, some dark fruits, and some wonderful slightly smoky whiskey notes. Flavour is more whiskey-dominant, bringing out smoked peat upfront (without being too smoky or peaty), some vanilla, a little unsweetened cocoa, and some woody roasted malt. Very complex - in fact, one of those most complex of this Ola Dubh series. Has the perfect amount of smoked peaty whiskey notes, mixed with some solid woody roast. Excellent stuff.

Bottle poured into a tulip glass. Pours jet black with minimal head, good lacing and retention. Nose is whiskey, oak, peat, alcohol, and vanilla. This is good stuff! The alcohol is well hidden and this brew goes down surprisingly smooth.

On tap @ Local Option. Pours deep inky black with thin oily mocha head. Aroma is big peaty scotch and a hint of dark roast malt. Taste is thin dark malt, toasty finish, with spare bitter hops. Peaty scotch dominates the finish, with earthy oaky notes. An ok beer dominated by an outstanding scotch. Worth seeking out for the scotch alone.
Tap at local option. Deep dark pour. I dont often like whiskey aged stuff but this one is a little mild on the smokey, peaty flavors so I enjoyed it very much.

lasting coffee head atop jet black body. Extreme alcohol heat nose, light anise, tar, plum and very heavy wood. Flavor ola dubh tar, wood, milk chocolate fighting among those through sweet finish, lingering heat and viscosity remind of liquor throughout.
Draft. A smooth as silk old ale aged in scotch casks. Very nice smoke as well as a dark and creamy palate.
Was just gonna tick this one but I want this to be know. This is probably the best cigar beer Ive ever tasted and get the award for manliest well-made beer to date from Shaftie.

On draft at Churchkey in D.C. Served alongside the Ola Dubh 12, also on draft.

The beer is black with a small tan head. The aroma offers roast, chocolate, alcohol, oak, smoke, scotch. Very nice. A bit more of the scotch character comes through in the aroma here.Lovely flavor following the scent. Easy to sip and savor. Medium bodied. Vanilla, chocolate, light booze. The 12 year was a bit smoother than the 21 year, though the barrel character was less pronounced in the younger version. Overall, a delicious beer.

On tap at Cambridge.  Dark brown with tan froth.  Nose is wood, scotch, peat and prune.  Medium to full body with a tang.  Taste is scotch, smoke and caramel.  Great barrel aging that perfectly complimented and highlighted the whiskey notes without getting too boozy.

Draft.  Creamy medium brown head atop black body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, whisky, roast, some vanilla, milk chocolate.  Taste is moderately sweet, whisky, roast, some milk chocolate, light vanilla, peay.  Medium-full body, low carbonation, light alcohol burn.

Draught in a flight. Then another pint. Pours an extremely black color with almost no head on it. Nose has some definite roasting in there, with that sour/bitterness that comes off from the scotch and a bit of a coffee smell. Taste is slightly smokey with a fair amount of the scotch coming through and SUPER smooth. Damn. This beer will put hair on your chest.

Cask. Handpull. My finishing beer at Churchkey in the colonies, less than a mile from that White House that the Brits burned 201 years ago, the bloody bastards. Extremely dark brown color, bright tan edge head. Aroma of dark bittersweet cocoa and a bit of vanilla. Taste starts with bittersweet cocoa, then the whisky kicks in, with its rich vanilla, smokey edge and dark fruit. Delicious.

On tap at Bottle Revolution (Raleigh)

Deep rich brown Ruth minor head. Beertender declared "BEST BEER EVER" when asked how it was.  Ranks in top 5 (3?) in my book...

One word description - smooth.  Beertender was correct in that it has the wonderful taste of a good beer, coffee, and  chocolate without any inkling of alcohol burn.  

Damn - I want a third, but have to get back to work...   Damn.....

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Great Scott. Nice beer that is a bit overpowering but gets better with each sip and beer. Roasted malts at first. Some peat aftertaste. Chocolate. The roast is too much at first but gets better as u drink.  Do not miss the chance for it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Paradiso Dupont.  Black pour, small beige head. So classic for this series and this is a gorgeous iteration; chocolate, integrated peat smoke, roasty bitterness. Smooth and not too rich. Bloody delicious.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2013 On draft a Pizzeria Paradiso in Dupont Circle D.C..  Pours black with a tan head.  Flavors of roasted malt, and intense smoky whisky notes.  Quite similar to the 12.  Very tasty.
